title: Biscuits With Mushroom Gravy and Grilled Green Onions at Whitfield
directions: To plate: Place some gravy on each plate. Pull a biscuit apart then put gravy on the biscuit bottom and place the top back on. Garnish with grilled green onions and serve with fresh greens, if desired.
ingredients: Chop the mushrooms, onion and garlic in food processor until smooth. Put a pan over medium heat. Add the butter and then the vegetables and cook thoroughly. Add the flour and continue cooking for a few minutes until well-incorporated, scraping and stirring constantly. Add the brandy and cook for 5 minutes longer. Add the cream and half-and-half and cook until bubbly. Season with the nutmeg and fresh sage. Serve immediately or refrigerate and heat later.
Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Toss the green onions with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill until soft, turning often so as not to char unevenly.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all dry ingredients. then add the butter. Mix by hand until the butter and flour become a crumbly mixture. Add the buttermilk, and gently mix until it becomes workable dough.

Roll out dough to approximately 1-inch high, and then fold and repeat. (It is important to use very gentle hands during the entire process or you will get tough, flat biscuits.) Fold and roll no more than 10 times. Next, either use a ring cutter or cut with a knife into a biscuit shape. Bake for 5 minutes, and then turn the pan and cook for another 5 to 6 minutes longer.
